required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Handheld Ultrasound-assisted Versus Palpation-guided Labor Combined Spinal-epidural Analgesia
clinical_study.official_title: Handheld Ultrasound-assisted Versus Palpation-guided Labor Combined Spinal-epidural Analgesia: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Parturients who need combined spinal-epidural analgesia for labour analgesia are randomly assigned to two groups. For the handheld ultrasound-assisted technique group, ultrasound with 3D navigation function is used to determine the needle insertion point and the insertion angle. For the conventional palpation-guided technique group, the interspinous space is detected by palpation. Procedure time, the number of needle passes, the number of needle insertion attempts, success rate, and complications are compared.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to determine whether handheld ultrasound-guidance can reduce procedural time for labor combined spinal-epidural analgesia compared with conventional surface landmark-guided technique.

primary_outcome.measure: Total duration of combined spinal-epidural procedure
primary_outcome.description: Identifying time (time required to complete the preprocedural spinal ultrasound or the assessment by palpation) + Procedural duration (time from the initial Tuohy needle insertion through the skin to the completion of the threading of the epidural catheter)

secondary_outcome.description: Number of times the puncture needle was redirected without removing it from the skin
Number of times the puncture needle was removed from the skin and reinserted
time from the initial Tuohy needle insertion through the skin to the completion of the threading of the epidural catheter
time required to complete the preprocedural spinal ultrasound or the assessment by palpation

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate at the first needle pass
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate at the first needle pass

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate at the first attempt
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate at the first attempt
Need to use alternative methods for success

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of interspace levels at which the insertion was attempted
secondary_outcome.description: Number of interspace levels at which the insertion was attempted

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate of dural puncture with needle-through-needle technique
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate of dural puncture with needle-through-needle technique

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of radicular pain, paresthesia, and bloody tapping
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of radicular pain, paresthesia, and bloody tapping during the procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural pain using 11-point verbal rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of pain during the procedure using 11-point verbal rating scale (0=no pain, 10=most pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural discomfort using 11-point verbal rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of discomfort during the procedure using 11-point verbal rating scale (0=no discomfort, 10=most discomfort imaginable)
Depth to the ligamentum flavum-dura mater complex (LFD) as determined by ultrasound
Depth of the needle when the epidural space and dural space are found (cm)
The need to reinsert a new epidural catheter due to lack of sufficient analgesia within 2 hours of the primary insertion

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction using 11-point verbal rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the end of the procedure to delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with the quality of labor analgesia using 11-point verbal rating scale (0=very unsatisfied, 10=very satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of back pain postpartum at the site of epidural insertion
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of back pain postpartum at the site of epidural insertion

arm_group.description: Participants will be received labor combined epidural-spinal analgesia using handheld ultrasound
Participants will be received labor combined epidural-spinal analgesia using conventional landmark-guided technique

intervention.description: Ultrasound with 3D navigation function is used to determine the needle insertion point and the insertion angle.
The interspinous space is detected by palpation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult parturients with ASA physical status classification I, II or III requiring a combined spinal-epidural for labor analgesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to neuraxial anesthesia (local anesthetics hypersensitivity, coagulopathy, needle insertion site infection, etc.)
- Difficulty in communication
- Severe cardiac disease
- History of spine surgery
- Anatomical abnormality of the lumbar spine
- Age under 18
